analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi

original: 16.61. Sanidassanattika, Āsavasāsavaduka🔽Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavañceva sāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanaappaṭigho naāsavo
analyzed: sa ni dassa na ttikaḥ āsavasāsavaduka  anidassana appaṭigham āsavañca iva sa āsavañca dhammam paṭicca na anidassana appaṭighaḥ na āsavaḥ
translated: The Visible-Range, with Pollutants and without Pollutants

original: ceva naanāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavañceva sāsavañca
analyzed: ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham āsavañca iva sa āsavañca
translated: With a visible-range object that is both a pollutant and has pollutants, there arises a non-visible-range object that is neither a pollutant nor without pollutants.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā …pe… anidassanaappaṭighaṁ āsavañceva sāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca naanidassanasappaṭigho naāsavo ceva naanāsavo ca dhammā
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati  hetu paccayā pe anidassana appaṭigham āsavam ca iva sa āsavam ca dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na āsavaḥ ca iva na anāsavaḥ ca dhammā
translated: With a visible-range object that is both a pollutant and has pollutants, there arises a non-visible-range object that is neither a pollutant nor without pollutants.🔽With a visible-range object that is both a pollutant and has pollutants, there arises a non-visible-range object that is neither a pollutant nor without pollutants, and a non-visible-range object that is neither a pollutant nor without pollutants.

original: uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cha ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: (In brief.) In the case of cause, there are six; in the case of object, there are three; … in the case of non-hindrance, there are six.

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sāsavañceva no ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho🔽naanāsavo ceva nanoāsavo ca dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ sāsavañceva🔽no ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanidassanasappaṭigho naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ sāsavañceva no ca āsavaṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nasanidassanasappaṭigho naanāsavo ceva nano ca āsavo naanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham sa āsavam ca iva no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ  na anāsavaḥ ca iva na noāsavaḥ ca dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana appaṭigham sa āsavam ca eva  no ca āsavam dhammam paṭicca na a nidassana sa paṭighaḥ na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana sappaṭigham sa āsavam ca iva no ca āsavam dhamma  paṭicca na sanidassana sappaṭighaḥ na anāsavaḥ ca iva na no ca āsavaḥ na anidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: Dependent on a non-evident, non-receiving, subject to cankers, and not a canker, there arises a non-evident, non-receiving, not subject to cankers, and not a canker, thought.
